com.github.robtimus.obfuscation.support

Class ObfuscatorUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.robtimus.obfuscation.support.ObfuscatorUtils

  • public final class ObfuscatorUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods that can be used for implementing Obfuscators.
    Author:
    Rob Spoor

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(CharSequence s,
                          int ch,
                          int fromIndex,
                          int toIndex)
        Returns the index within a CharSequence range of the first occurrence of a specific character. This method is like String.indexOf(int, int), but it works on any CharSequence, and it has an upper bound as well.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to search.
        ch - The character to search for.
        fromIndex - The start of the CharSequence range, inclusive.
        toIndex - The end of the CharSequence range, exclusive.
        Returns:
        The index of the given character in the given CharSequence, or -1 if the character does not occur in the given CharSequence in the specified range.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.

      • lastIndexOf

        public static int lastIndexOf(CharSequence s,
                              int ch,
                              int fromIndex,
                              int toIndex)
        Returns the index within a CharSequence of the last occurrence of a specific character. This method is like String.lastIndexOf(int, int) using toIndex - 1 as second argument, but it works on any CharSequence, and it has a lower bound as well.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to search.
        ch - The character to search for.
        fromIndex - The start of the CharSequence range, inclusive.
        toIndex - The end of the CharSequence range, exclusive.
        Returns:
        The index of the given character in the given CharSequence, or -1 if the character does not occur in the given CharSequence in the specified range.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.
        Since:
        1.5

      • skipLeadingWhitespace

        public static int skipLeadingWhitespace(CharSequence s,
                                        int fromIndex,
                                        int toIndex)
        Skips leading whitespace in a range of a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to skip leading whitespace in.
        fromIndex - The start of the range to start skipping whitespace in, inclusive.
        toIndex - The end of the range to start skipping whitespace in, exclusive.
        Returns:
        The index in the given CharSequence of the first non-whitespace character, or toIndex if the CharSequence contains only whitespace.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indexes are invalid for the given CharSequence.

      • skipTrailingWhitespace

        public static int skipTrailingWhitespace(CharSequence s,
                                         int fromIndex,
                                         int toIndex)
        Skips trailing whitespace in a range of a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to skip trailing whitespace in.
        fromIndex - The start of the range to start skipping whitespace in, inclusive.
        toIndex - The end of the range to start skipping whitespace in, exclusive.
        Returns:
        The index in the given CharSequence of the first non-whitespace character, or fromIndex if the CharSequence contains only whitespace.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indexes are invalid for the given CharSequence.

      • getChars

        public static void getChars(CharSequence src,
                            int srcBegin,
                            int srcEnd,
                            char[] dst,
                            int dstBegin)
        Copies characters from a CharSequence into a destination character array. This method is a more generic version of String.getChars(int, int, char[], int), StringBuilder.getChars(int, int, char[], int) and StringBuffer.getChars(int, int, char[], int).
        Parameters:
        src - The CharSequence to copy characters from.
        srcBegin - The index of the first character in the CharSequence to copy.
        srcEnd - The index after the last character in the CharSequence to copy.
        dst - The destination array.
        dstBegin - The start offset in the destination array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence or character array is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any of the indexes is invalid.

                              int index)

        Parameters:
        array - The array to check for.
        index - The index to check.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given array is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index is negative or exceeds the given array's length.

        NullPointerException - If the given array is null.

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given array is null.

      • reader

        public static Reader reader(CharSequence s,
                            int start,
                            int end)
        Returns a Reader for a portion of a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence to return a Reader for.
        start - The start index of the portion, inclusive.
        end - The end index of the portion, inclusive.
        Returns:
        A Reader for the given portion of the given CharSequence.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given start index is negative, the given end index is larger than the given CharSequence's length, or the given start index is larger than the given end index.

      • writer

        public static Writer writer(Appendable appendable)
        Returns an Appendable as a Writer. If the given Appendable is a Writer, it is returned unmodified. Otherwise, a wrapper is returned that will delegate all calls to the wrapped Appendable. This includes flush() if the wrapped Appendable implements Flushable, and close() if the wrapped Appendable implements Closeable or AutoCloseable.

        Note that the behaviour of closing a Writer wrapper depends on the wrapped Appendable. If it does not support closing, or if it still allows text to be appended after closing, then the closed AppendableWriter allows text to be appended after closing. If it does not allow text to be appended after closing, then neither will the closed Writer wrapper.

        Parameters:
        appendable - The Appendable to return a Writer for.
        Returns:
        The given Appendable itself if it's already a Writer, otherwise a wrapper around the given Appendable.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Appendable is null.

      • counting

        public static CountingReader counting(Reader input)
        Returns a Reader that counts all text read from another Reader.
        Parameters:
        input - The Reader to read from.
        Returns:
        A Reader that counts all text read from the given Reader.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Reader is null.
        Since:
        1.4

      • copyTo

        public static Reader copyTo(Reader input,
                            Appendable appendable)
        Returns a Reader that transparently appends all text read from another Reader to an Appendable. If the returned Reader is closed, the given Reader will be closed as well. The Appendable will not be closed though.
        Parameters:
        input - The Reader to read from.
        appendable - The Appendable to write to.
        Returns:
        A Reader that transparently appends all text read from the given Reader to the given Appendable.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Reader or Appendable is null.

      • readAtMost

        public static Reader readAtMost(Reader input,
                                int limit)
        Returns a Reader that is able to read only a portion of text from another Reader.
        Parameters:
        input - The Reader to read from.
        limit - The maximum number of characters to read from the given Reader.
        Returns:
        A Reader that is able to read at most limit characters from the given Reader.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Reader is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given limit is negative.
        Since:
        1.2

      • appendAtMost

        public static LimitAppendable appendAtMost(Appendable appendable,
                                           long limit)
        Returns an Appendable that will discard text after a specific amount of text has been appended.
        Parameters:
        appendable - The Appendable to append to.
        limit - The maximum number of characters to append to the given Appendable.
        Returns:
        An Appendable that will discard text after a specific amount of text has been appended.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Appendable is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given limit is negative.
        Since:
        1.4

                    throws IOException

      • append

        public static void append(int c,
                          Appendable destination)
                   throws IOException
        Appends a single character to an Appendable. The character to be written is contained in the 16 low-order bits of the given integer value; the 16 high-order bits are ignored.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to append.
        destination - The Appendable to append to.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given Appendable is null.
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • append

        public static void append(char c,
                          int count,
                          Appendable destination)
                   throws IOException
        Appends a single character a number of times to an Appendable.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to append.
        count - The number of times to append the character.
        destination - The Appendable to append to.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given number of times is negative.
        NullPointerException - If the given Appendable is null.
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • append

        public static void append(char[] array,
                          int start,
                          int end,
                          Appendable destination)
                   throws IOException
        Appends a portion of an array of characters to an Appendable.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to append a portion of.
        destination - The Appendable to append to.
        start - The start index of the portion to append, inclusive.
        end - The end index of the portion to append, exclusive.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given array or Appendable is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given start index is negative, the given end index is larger than the given array's length, or the given start index is larger than the given end index.
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
